physical_object.name: black swivel office chair with padded seat and backrest

assignments.utilization_method: Stand beside the chair and use the padded seat (or backrest) as the contact surface. Its fabric-covered foam compresses smoothly under the stick’s tip and rebounds gently, providing a broad, forgiving plane that closely matches the cushioned resistance of an artist’s canvas.

Grip the battery lengthwise in a tripod grip. Its 1.4 cm diameter metal cylinder and low mass are very close to a real marker’s feel, allowing highly accurate pen-like strokes and fingertip rotations to change orientation.

physical_object.name: yellow and orange Japanese snack bag

assignments.utilization_method: Hold the sealed corner of the bag like a tube’s neck. With the other hand, apply rolling pressure from the opposite end toward the ‘nozzle’ corner; the air-filled foil bag compresses and wrinkles under your fingers, providing a convincingly soft, deformable response closely matching the feel of squeezing paint out of a tube.

physical_object.name: white rectangular desk/table with metal legs

assignments.utilization_method: Simply use the tabletop as a large horizontal writing plane. Its smooth laminate finish produces consistent, light-to-medium friction under the battery tip, very close to the feel of standard printer paper on a desk and ideal for long, continuous strokes.

physical_object.name: small black clip-on USB desk fan

assignments.utilization_method: Hold the fan’s slender support post about midway up using a precision grip.  The post’s diameter and rigidity reproduce a paint-brush handle, and you can rotate it between fingers while making gentle strokes; the fan head’s slight top-heavy weight provides tactile feedback similar to a loaded brush.

Grab the rubberized bottom grip exactly as you would the roller’s handle. Extend the telescoping rod to full length to approximate the metal frame distance between handle and roller head. Swing broad strokes through the air; the distributed mass along the rod reproduces the leverage and light top-weight of a real paint roller, while the round handle fills the palm ergonomically.
